case_vignette: a 72-year-old man presents to the clinic with an intensely itchy rash on his abdomen and chest that appeared 2 months prior. he denies starting any new medications prior to the onset of the eruption and any systemic symptoms. although he traveled and stayed in hotels recently, he reports that his wife does not exhibit any similar symptoms. physical examination reveals numerous discrete papules, crusted papules, and papulovesicles on the chest, abdomen, and mid-back. his upper and lower extremities, face, and groin are unaffected.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an extremely itchy rash on my abdomen and chest that started 2 months ago.
Have you noticed any changes in color or texture of the rash since it first appeared?
The rash includes numerous separate small bumps, some crusted bumps, and tiny blister-like bumps.
Do you have any allergies or have you started using any new products like soap or laundry detergent?
No, I have not started using any new products or medications before the rash appeared.
Is there any family history of skin conditions or allergies?
No, there is no family history of skin conditions or allergies.
Have you experienced any other symptoms besides the rash, such as fever, joint pain, or recent illnesses?
No, I have not experienced any other symptoms besides the rash.
Have you been in contact with nature recently, like camping, hiking, or gardening where you might have been exposed to plants like poison ivy?
No, but I have stayed in hotels recently during my travels.
Are the rashes localized only on your abdomen and chest or have they spread to other areas of your body?
The rash is on my abdomen, chest, and mid-back, but my upper and lower extremities, face, and groin are unaffected.
Final Diagnosis: Scabies
